headline: Brownie Cupcakes
description: Make delicious brownie cupcakes with this easy, generations-tested recipe that calls for 6 ingredients. It's gotta be good if it's grandma's recipe!
name: Brownie Cupcakes

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Line 18 muffin cups with paper liners.
Melt butter and chocolate chips in a saucepan over low heat, stirring until smooth, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool, 10 to 15 minutes.

Beat sugar and eggs in a mixing bowl with an electric mixer until thoroughly combined. Mix in flour and vanilla. Fold in cooled chocolate mixture until smooth. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 1/2 full.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean or with a few moist crumbs, about 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: These were so good. My family loved them so much! They loved the crispiness of the top! My family loves peanut butter and chocolate so I topped with homemade peanut butter buttercream frosting. So yummy and pretty too!

Made these gluten-free by using Bobs Red Mill all purpose gluten-free flour and gluten-free baking squares, which made them lower in sugar as well. Turned out great! Used some of The brownies to make a tunnel for my grandsons train birthday cake.
Easy instructions to follow, was liked by everyone because it’s not very sweet but you can taste the chocolate flavour. We topped it with whipped cream
Amazing!!! I made actual brownies in the pan and added some chopped almonds and choc chips and it turned out great!
This is easy to make and has great flavor. It is yummy! I added frosting and it was delicious
These were great! We didn't have white sugar, so I used brown, and they came out delicious!
Simple but great

When I took these cupcakes out of the oven, THEY FELL!!!!! They looked awful, the tops caved in and were super crispy not to mention that they were almost hollow. Also, didn't really have a strong chocolaty flavor. Very disappointing. :( :(
NO I DID NOT MAKE ENY CHANNGES BUT IT WAS DELISOUS
I followed this recipe to a tee. Not bad at all.

These turned out amazing! Added some chocolate chips to the batter as I saw another user recommended, and topped with buttercream frosting. Delicious recipe, even the only person in the house who dislikes chocolate enjoyed them! It made more batter than planned, so I filled the cupcake tins nearly to the top and baked them for a bit longer. Still tasted great, I highly recommend this recipe to any chocolate fiends looking for a fun recipe to follow :)
BEST BROWNIES EVER. And super easy to make
I made these for my sisters birthday, and they were great! They were the first thing I ever baked. They were very easy, although I added more chocolate chips. 10/10 would recommend!
These were amazing! I had to add 2 ingredients which were salt and baking powder. I have made this recipe about 4 times now and I love them everytime!
Loved this recipe and added the suggestions from previous ratings. Used 1/4 cup dark cocoa and a handful of mini chocolate chips to the batter. It made 20 cupcakes!

i used 3 eggs. 1 cup sugar. 3/4 cup flour. 3/4 cup choc chips plus tablespoon of white choc chips.
 just because that was all that I had!
These are so good!!! Definitely making again!!

Yummy and super easy! The only change I made was to add half of the batter into the cupcake paper, sprinkle in a few chocolate chips, then add the rest of the batter. It gives them an extra chocolatey gooey center.

My husband and I are in Florida for a month visiting our daughter and her family. We rent a home and I don't fully stock all the ingredients I keep in my pantry at home for just a month. We're heading for Sunday dinner at my daughter's home and I came across this simple but yummy recipe while looking for a dessert to make with ingredients I have on hand. I followed the recipe exactly and added about 3/4 cup mini chocolate chips. I love the crunchy tops of these cupcakes and the soft middle! If you're looking for a fudgy chocolate brownie, these won't do. But they're delicious with a more mellow chocolate flavor and I'll make them again! I did get 23 brownies from the recipe.

Made these yesterday. Followed the recipe and the number made and baking time was right on. They even look exactly like the picture. :-) My husband and I had them for dessert with vanilla ice cream. We enjoyed them and will definitely make them again.
Kids loved them
This recipe is easy to follow.I used dark chocolate ,and add hazelnut inside.
too much butter made them oily. I'll never do this recipe again.

I added 1 tsp cocoa powder and 1/4 tsp baking powder to the flour. I also added about 1/4 cup additional chocolate chips. I don’t know if it made a big difference as this is the first time I have made them. I think adding a few chopped pecans would be yummy. My husband text me saying “those were good”.
Very boring. Kind of a light brown color. Very little chocolate taste. I followed the recipe exactly, but they’re not to my family’s taste.

I’m sorry grandma Paige but this recipe is a big no! I decided to give it a chance despite it being vague as anything. And I really wish I didn’t. I don’t know what part of this is brownie maybe it’s the coloring It doesn’t taste anything like a brownie or a cupcake or anything in between. It was just awful I can’t even describe how awful it was just awful. I gave the keys to my mother just to make sure it wasn’t me but now she agrees it’s awful. I don’t know what’s with all these rave reviews saying it’s amazing obviously those people haven’t had chocolate in years. I’m sorry grandma Paige but you need to get out of the kitchen.
I made this and it was absolutely perfect! The only thing I would recommend, is do 3 cups chocolate chips not just 1. Mine needed a lot more chocolate then when they say to
Great! Does need to cook a little longer than 30 minutes, but still good.
Tasted just like a lighter brownie. I topped it with Oreo frosting off allrecipes site. Very good!
Added nuts on top. The best brownie cupcakes ever!

Love the texture of these yummy brownie cakes. I did add chopped walnuts to the top just before baking. There not quite as chocolaty as I would like. Next time I’ll add some chocolate chips to the batter.
Made them and served them as is this time. Still a crowd favorite!
Simple but perfect. It was a hit from my fiance, my mom and nephews! They are requesting for a second batch Lol

These were a huge hit with the husband kids and in laws!
Very easy to make and I’m now going to try the same recipe with white chocolate chips and butterscotch!
Thanks for the recipe and the extra lbs on my hips! Haha 

—Mrs D Taylor, Mullica Hill NJ
Do not make these. This is not a brownie or a cupcake. This recipe is very wrong somehow
No changes, followed exactly. Cupcakes flopped inside itself and was unable to even get them out of the tin! Horrible recipe!
I don’t think there was enough chocolate, they tasted more like cookies than brownies...
This cupcake is amazing, very moist. I did half of the recipe, but I would have done the entire one, because the cupcakes finished in the same hour I took down from the oven.

These were a little sweet the first time I made them according to the recipe. So the second time, I decreased the sugar by 1/4 cup and added 1/4 cup of cocoa power. The result was a smooth, chocolatey taste that wasn’t too sweet.

Great recipe, thank you!! The tops are crunchy and the middles are ooey gooey good! I used PC decadent milk chocolate chips they didn’t melt properly, not in the double boiler nor in the microwave, lol... they still worked out! I will definitely make these again...
Made this recipe and added a full piece of Carmel when 1/2 done - may have been to heavy as they still sunk to the bottom of the cupcake.
These cupcakes were great! The ones in our first batch sank, but in our second batch we added baking powder and they didn't sink. I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND ADDING A TEASPOON OF BAKING POWDER!

The recipe turned out great, but I had to make a small change. We couldn't find baking chocolate chips, so we just used regular ones. We heated the choc chips in the microwave at thirty second intervals (without the butter) and stirred in between each turn. Then we let it cool. We folded it into the batter then slowly poured in one cup of melted butter.

All my friends liked it but some found it too rich, I don't recommend putting chocolate chips in it as they sink to the bottom and burn! Also the top was weird texture compared to the rest of the tasty brownie
It's delicious but when it cooled down the brownie shrunk
Followed the recipe and it was a bit dry.

I don't know what I am doing wrong, but I have tried this recipe two separate times and failed miserably both times. Followed the recipe with no changes. Both times they sank completely in the middle.

Very good brownies and so easy. I did add a bit more chocolate chips. I took half the batter and added about a cup of coconut and chopped pecans. So, I had a dozen by recipe and about a dozen more with coconut and nuts. Both turned out very good. I liked the coconut ones a bit more, but that is just me. These were so very easy. Definitely will make again.
They are very good and easy to make
They turned out great! I halfed the recipe and I got 7 brownies which worked perfectly.
Totally did them wrong, but they tasted okay. Were difficult to remove from liners.
It didn't rise it just is hollow.

I followed the recipe exactly. these were easy to put together and turned out beautifully. I checked at 20 minutes and they tested as done. I didn't have enough to do all of them in large muffin cups so I ended up making 10 mini muffin size. I tested them first at 10 minutes and they were actually done at 15 minutes. These turned out cute! 
I agree with other reviewers that I'd like to have a boost in chocolate flavor next time. My thought is that next time I will stir some mini chocolate chips into the batter. ( I hate to mess around with the consistency by adding more melted chips or cocoa powder.) I am going to frost these with my granddaughter and decorate with dyed coconut and jelly beans to make little Easter Baskets for a cute dessert.

This was soooo good! It was moist and light, but I agree with everyone else, it needs more chocolate! I would have put a yummy chocolate frosting on these if I had time because that would have worked beautifully! Or you could put chocolate chips in the batter. But all in all, it was delicious.

Me and my friend changed the recipe by doing step 3 before step 2. I feel like that was a necessary change because the chocolate mixture might have cooled too much. But besides that this recipe is really good, I suggest it.
The chocolate took a lot longer than told to melt.

The first time I made these, I did add a pinch of salt and a large handful of really good quality mini chocolate chips before baking. I made half a batch and that made 8 delicious cupcakey brownies. I wondered what it would be like, the next time I made them, to make them without the cupcake wrappers. BIG MISTAKE! BIG, BIG MISTAKE!! They refused to come out of the cupcake pans resembling anything like a cupcake, just bits and pieces. I had to take a knife and scrape out the bits and BITS of brownie cupcakes.

NOTE TO SELF! Next time, make sure to use cupcake wrappers and don't even think of trying to not use the wrappers!!

They were delicious and super yummy the first time I made them and thought a scoop of good vanilla ice cream would really enhance them.
There's nothing I just LOVED it!

I will never make ordinary chocolate cupcakes again. So delicious! One word of advice: fill cups 3/4 full (still makes 18) and add 3-5 minutes to cooking time. These don't rise like regular cupcakes and they sink in a little after they cool.
My cupcakes fell in the middle. I've baked for years and never had this happen. The chocolate flavor was severely lacking. These were awful.
Super easy and SO good! They were perfectly crunchy on top while still moist and chewy on the inside. I also added some cream cheese frosting on top and it paired very nicely!

I made these exactly as the recipe was written. It didn't say what kind of chocolate chips to use so I used half milk and half dark chocolate. They turned out awesome and chocolaty and chewy. Will definitely make again. As a side note I used foil muffins cups for the first time and they were great too.

This recipe is nothing short of amazing! I doubled the recipe for the singing at church. I used dark chocolate chips and I had all the ingredients on hand. It was such a easy recipe to follow. I put them in the oven for 28 minutes and they were perfect! Keep the recipes coming!!!
These are literally brownies in cupcake liners! I love them so much!!!!!! They're so incredible, and they went perfectly with "basic buttercream frosting" also from this site. Awesomeness!!!!
great recipe. so simple . I've made it twice now. I got about 23 cup cakes each time....They were gobbled up. Perfect for a pot luck.
This is so yummy!!! I made this for my homework. Next time we will change the chocolate chips to fruits and cat grass so my cats can enjoy too!!!

Recipe called for 18 cupcake liners . I made just half the recipe and filled 12 cupcake liners. But maybe my pans were smaller than most . However, they were excellent and everyone who tasted them asked for the recipe. I will definitely make them again!

Thought this sounded good for dessert tonight with company. Prepared exactly according to recipe. Totally failed. Cupcake tops all cracked and sunken in. I'm on my way to the bakery to pick up tonight's dessert!! Yikes!

This recipe was delicious, easy to put together and also made the exact amount as described, that doesn't happen too often!
I will certainly use this recipe again, I used semi sweet chips, but next time I might try, milk chocolate chips or dark chocolate chips. Just to change it up a bit for my chocolate lovers.
Thank you!!

I'm sorry but these were just awful . The first batch were really dry and tasteless . I threw them out. I made a batch with extra chocolate chips and a pinch of salt and it still was awful. I usually make the desert for all of the BBQ'S and have requests for the recipes .

It is chocolate cup cake not brownie chocolate cup cake. If you want brownie, Reduce the egg to 2, add couple tbs coco powder and couple tbs sour cream, do not over bake. If tooth pick come out clean means over baked for brownie.
These cupcakes were easy to make and were mess free. They didn't rise a lot but looked great! I haven't tasted them yet but still easy recipe. I would make this again.

I made this one day for my family when I was bored of making banana bread and wanted a change. These are literally the best things I have put in my mouth. This is the only site I use to find recipes and it never ceases to amaze me!I followed the recipe exactly and it came out wonderful!
This recipe was amazing and turned out awesome! I will most definitely be making these again.

This was a fun recipe, i was able to make these with my three little sisters, with things we already had in the house! I would say that they could be more chocolatey, we might add some cocoa powder next time.

I made these for a poker party. I cut the recipe in half because I was low on ingredients. I used half milk chocolate and half dark chocolate to make the chocolate flavor stronger. I followed the recommendation of others and added a pinch of salt. Instead of baking regular sized cupcakes, I made mini cupcakes. I baked for 10 -11 minutes, that's when the toothpick came out clean. The half recipe made 36 mini cupcakes. They were delicious and perfect snack size. I would definitely make these again!
These had a great texture and were a big hit. I did add 2 T. unsweetened cocoa powder and a bit of salt.
It was absolutely scrumptious. As an amateur baker, this was easy and perfect. I only added 1/4 a cup of cocoa powder and a bit of salt, it made a world of a difference.

I would DEFINITELY make these cupcakes again. The only thing I would say that isn't really good about these is that they stick to the cupcake liners like glue and are really chewy. But I really don't mind!
I loved the concept but my cupcakes sunk into nothing.

Delicious,Flaky,and light as a feather.
SO good.
Way too much butter, and they all collapsed in the center.
These delicious treats are perfect for any occasion. Next time, I might try them with frosting :) Anyway, these are amazing and the ingredients are right in your pantry.
Deliciously moist inside with a crunchy outer shell. I followed the advice of fellow reviewers and doubled the chocolate chips and added a pinch of salt. This is now my favorite brownie recipe!
Easy enough to make, but the chocolate was lacking, big time.
Came out awesome and tasted great 10/10 would make again ??

QUICK NOTES: • use dark chocolate • use less sugar • make full size brownies not mini ones FULL COMMENT: I made this recipie in mini cupcake tins. About the batter: The batter was a good consistency but personally I would have added less sugar because it was too sweet for my liking and I would recommend using dark chocolate chips instead of semi-sweet for an extra chocolatey taste that I think these brownies were lacking. About the cupcake: The mini brownie cupcakes took almost the same amount time to bake as the recommended time for the regular size, and when one of the batches came out it still did not look done. After all of the brownie cupcakes cooled down they had really crumbly looking tops and when I bit into them they were rock hard on the top and oddly soft in the center.
I loved that almost everyone would have these ingredients on hand. I didn't have to go out and buy anything specific for it.
These are pretty good, but if I were to make them again, I'd use dark chocolate chips. Used milk chocolate and they're a little too light colored and sweet.
I too added cocoa powder and then some white chocolate chips to batter, so yummy!! Made them for my daughters birthday party, a hit.
Did not have success with this recipe. Every single brownie couple baked up nice and pretty, then every single one collapsed.
Did not have success with this recipe. Every single brownie couple baked up nice and pretty, then every single one collapsed.
I will always make it again
Very easy recipe really fun to follow But should call that a cupcake+brownie = crowdie

I substituted 3/4 cup of cocoa for the chocolate chips and 1 cup of sugar and several squirts of stevia for the missing sugar, everything else was the same. I liked them and will try them again when I have the chocolate chips. Mine were like chocolate cake. but they were good.
loved this recipe! it turned out perfectly and I added white chocolate chips to mine which made it even better! I will definitely make this again!

I was very excited to make these because they sounded so delicious, but they didn't turn out how I hoped. I'm not sure if I did something wrong, but they ended up being really dry and chalky tasting even though I followed the recipe perfectly. I tried to add frosting on top to sweeten them up but it still didn't make much a a difference. Overall, a disappointment.
Really quick and just what I was looking for :)
We added a simple frosting which made them even better! They were a great success!
